Uses of Class
dkeep.logic.GameObject

    • Uses of GameObject in dkeep.logic

      Subclasses of GameObject in dkeep.logic 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Character
      Represents a game character, derives from GameObject
      class  Club
      Represents the ogre's weapon, extends GameObject The club representation symbol is '*' A club is both passable and movable
      class  Collision
      Represents an overlap between a key and an ogre, or between a key and a club The collision representation symbol is '$' A collision is passable, but not movable Extends GameObject
      class  Door
      Represents a door, extends GameObject
      class  DoorClosed
      Represents a closed door, extends Door The closed door representation symbol is 'I' A closed door is neither passable, nor movable
      class  DoorOpened
      Represents an open door, extends Door The closed door representation symbol is 'S' An open door is not movable, yet it's passable
      class  Empty
      Represents an empty cell in a dungeon, extends GameObject The empty cell representation symbol is ' ' An empty cell is passable but not movable
      class  Guard
      represents a guard, extends Character The guard representation symbol is 'G', when stunned(drunken personality) is 'g' A guard is both passable and movable
      class  Hero
      represents a hero, extends Character The hero representation symbol is 'H', if it has attacking abilities is 'A', if it has got the key in level 2 is 'K' A hero is both passable and movable
      class  Key
      Represents a key, extends GameObject The key representation symbol is 'k' A key is passable but not movable
      class  Lever
      Represents a lever, extends GameObject The lever representation symbol is 'k' A lever is passable but not movable A lever is in all equal to the key, except that it opens all doors in the current level
      class  Ogre
      Represents an ogre, extends Character The ogre representaion symbol is 'O', if it is stunned changes to '8' An ogre is both passable and movable
      class  Wall
      Represents a wall, extends GameObject The wall representation symbol is 'X' A wall is neither passable nor movable
      Methods in dkeep.logic that return GameObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GameObject[][] Game.createDungeon(int dungeonIdentifier, int[][] dungeonModel)
      Creates a matrix composed by all game elements represented by objects
      GameObject[][] Dungeon.getDungeonInstant() 
      GameObject[][] Game.getMap() 
      GameObject[][] Dungeon.getMap() 
      static GameObject Auxiliary.getNewEntity(Point coord, int identifier)
      Used to populate objects in class Game
      static GameObject Auxiliary.getNewEntity(Point coord, int identifier, Guard.Personality personality)
      Used to populate objects in class Game, gives special attention to guard objects)
      GameObject Dungeon.getTile(Point p)
      Returns the object located at a given position
      Methods in dkeep.logic that return types with arguments of type GameObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> Game.getAllObjects() 
      Methods in dkeep.logic with parameters of type GameObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean GameObject.equals(GameObject object)
      Two objects are equal if they have the same symbol and coordinates
      boolean Game.InteractionStateMachine(Character character, GameObject nextTile, Point characterNextCoord)
      Determines what happens in the dungeon based on the character currently being analyzed and the tile he will move to
      void Dungeon.setTile(Point p, GameObject object)
      Puts a given game object in a given position of the dungeon
      Method parameters in dkeep.logic with type arguments of type GameObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String Dungeon.printDungeonString(java.util.ArrayList<GameObject> allObjects)
      Turns the complete dungeon into a string representation(with the according objects representaion symbol)
      Constructors in dkeep.logic with parameters of type GameObject 
      Constructor and Description
      Dungeon(GameObject[][] dungeon)
      Dungeon constructor
